Authors: J. F. J. White, R. F. Sullivan
Title: Phoma glomerata as a mycoparasite of powdery mildew.
Abstract:
A study was made of some powdery mildew hyperparasites.
Hyperparasitic Phoma and Ampelomyces species are frequently confused.
Several isolates of fungi, previously attributed to genus Ampelomyces,
were shown to belong to genus Phoma through study of morphology and rDNA
ITS1 sequence analysis. The species was identified as Phoma glomerata
and was demonstrated to effectively colonize and suppress development of
powdery mildew.
